member.name: F:CSCore.AudioSubTypes.MPEG_ADTS_AAC
member.summary: Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) audio in Audio Data Transport Stream (ADTS) format. The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_ADTS_AAC.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral band replication (SBR) or parametric stereo (PS) tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: F:CSCore.AudioSubTypes.MPEG_RAW_AAC

member.name: F:CSCore.AudioSubTypes.MPEG_LOAS
member.summary: MPEG-4 audio transport stream with a synchronization layer (LOAS) and a multiplex layer (LATM). The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_LOAS.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral SBR or PS tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: P:CSCore.WaveFormat.BlockAlign
member.summary: Gets the block alignment, in bytes. The block alignment is the minimum atomic unit of data. For PCM data, the block alignment is the number of bytes used by a single sample, including data for both channels if the data is stereo. For example, the block alignment for 16-bit stereo PCM is 4 bytes (2 channels 2 bytes per sample).

member.name: M:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioCaptureClient.GetBufferNative(System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32@,CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags@,System.UInt64@,System.UInt64@)
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the next available packet of data in the capture endpoint buffer. http: //msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd370859(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: Pointer to a pointer variable into which the method writes the starting address of the next data packet that is available for the client to read.
Variable into which the method writes the frame count (the number of audio frames available in the data packet). The client should either read the entire data packet or none of it.
Variable into which the method writes the buffer-status flags.
Variable into which the method writes the device position of the first audio frame in the data packet. The device position is expressed as the number of audio frames from the start of the stream.
Variable into which the method writes the value of the performance counter at the time that the audio endpoint device recorded the device position of the first audio frame in the data packet.

member.name: M:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioCaptureClient.GetBuffer(System.UInt32@,CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags@,System.UInt64@,System.UInt64@)
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the next available packet of data in the capture endpoint buffer. For more information see .
member.param: Variable into which the method writes the frame count (the number of audio frames available in the data packet). The client should either read the entire data packet or none of it.
Variable into which the method writes the buffer-status flags.
Variable into which the method writes the device position of the first audio frame in the data packet. The device position is expressed as the number of audio frames from the start of the stream.
Variable into which the method writes the value of the performance counter at the time that the audio endpoint device recorded the device position of the first audio frame in the data packet.
member.returns: Pointer to a variable which stores the starting address of the next data packet that is available for the client to read.
member.remarks: Use Marshal.Copy to convert the pointer to the buffer into an array.

member.name: M:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioCaptureClient.GetBuffer(System.UInt32@,CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags@)
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the next available packet of data in the capture endpoint buffer. http: //msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd370859(v=vs.85).aspx
member.remarks: Use Marshal.Copy to convert the pointer to the buffer into an array.

member.param: The number of audio frames that the client read from the capture buffer. This parameter must be either equal to the number of frames in the previously acquired data packet or 0.

member.summary: The GetNextPacketSize method retrieves the number of frames in the next data packet in the capture endpoint buffer. See .

member.summary: Gets the size of the next packet in frames (the size of one frame equals the blockalign value of the waveformat).

member.name: T:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags
member.summary: Defines flags that indicate the status of an audio endpoint buffer.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags.DataDiscontinuity
member.summary: The data in the packet is not correlated with the previous packet's device position; this is possibly due to a stream state transition or timing glitch.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags.Silent
member.summary: Treat all of the data in the packet as silence and ignore the actual data values.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags.TimestampError
member.summary: The time at which the device's stream position was recorded is uncertain. Thus, the client might be unable to accurately set the time stamp for the current data packet.

member.summary: Defines flags that describe an input stream. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd375502(v=vs.85).aspx.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags.WholeSamples
member.summary: The stream contains whole samples. Samples do not span multiple buffers, and buffers do not contain partial samples.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags.SingleSamplePerBuffer
member.summary: Each buffer contains exactly one sample.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags.FixedSampleSize
member.summary: The stream is discardable. Within calls to IMediaObject::ProcessOutput, the DMO can discard data for this stream without copying it to an output buffer.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags.HoldsBuffers
member.summary: The DMO performs lookahead on the incoming data, and may hold multiple input buffers for this stream.

member.name: T:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags
member.summary: Defines flags that describe an output buffer. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd375508(v=vs.85).aspx.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags.SyncPoint
member.summary: The beginning of the data is a synchronization point. A synchronization point is a random access point. For encoded video, this a sample that can be used as a decoding start point (key frame). For uncompressed audio or video, every sample is a synchronization point.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags.Time
member.summary: The buffer's time stamp is valid. The buffer's indicated time length is valid.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags.TimeLength
member.summary: The buffer's indicated time length is valid.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags.Incomplete
member.summary: There is still input data available for processing, but the output buffer is full.

member.summary: Flags that describe an output stream. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd375509(v=vs.85).aspx.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.WholeSamples
member.summary: The stream contains whole samples. Samples do not span multiple buffers, and buffers do not contain partial samples.

member.summary: Each buffer contains exactly one sample.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.FixedSampleSize
member.summary: All the samples in this stream are the same size.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.Discardable
member.summary: The stream is discardable. Within calls to IMediaObject::ProcessOutput, the DMO can discard data for this stream without copying it to an output buffer.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.Optional
member.summary: The stream is optional. An optional stream is discardable. Also, the application can ignore this stream entirely; it does not have to set the media type for the stream. Optional streams generally contain additional information, or data not needed by all applications.

member.name: T:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MediaFoundationAttributes
member.summary: see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms696989%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

member.name: T:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFAttributes
member.summary: Provides a generic way to store key/value pairs on an object. The keys are GUIDs, and the values can be any of the following data types: UINT32, UINT64, double, GUID, wide-character string, byte array, or IUnknown pointer. The standard implementation of this interface holds a thread lock while values are added, deleted, or retrieved. For a list of predefined attribute GUIDs, see Media Foundation Attributes. Each attribute GUID has an expected data type. The various "set" methods in IMFAttributes do not validate the type against the attribute GUID. It is the application's responsibility to set the correct type for the attribute. To create an empty attribute store, call MFCreateAttributes.

member.name: T:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFInputStreamInfo
member.summary: Contains information about an input stream on a Media Foundation transform (MFT). To get these values, call IMFTransform::GetInputStreamInfo.
member.remarks: Before the media types are set, the only values that should be considered valid are the MFT_INPUT_STREAM_REMOVABLE and MFT_INPUT_STREAM_OPTIONAL flags in the dwFlags member. -The MFT_INPUT_STREAM_REMOVABLE flag indicates that the stream can be deleted. -The MFT_INPUT_STREAM_OPTIONAL flag indicates that the stream is optional and does not require a media type. After you set a media type on all of the input and output streams (not including optional streams), all of the values returned by the GetInputStreamInfo method are valid. They might change if you set different media types.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFInputStreamInfo.HnsMaxLatency
member.summary: Maximum amount of time between an input sample and the corresponding output sample, in 100-nanosecond units. For example, an MFT that buffers two samples, each with a duration of 1 second, has a maximum latency of two seconds. If the MFT always turns input samples directly into output samples, with no buffering, the latency is zero.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFInputStreamInfo.Flags
member.summary: Bitwise OR of zero or more flags from the InputStreamInfoFlags enumeration.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFInputStreamInfo.Size
member.summary: The minimum size of each input buffer, in bytes. If the size is variable or the MFT does not require a specific size, the value is zero. For uncompressed audio, the value should be the audio frame size, which you can get from the MF_MT_AUDIO_BLOCK_ALIGNMENT attribute in the media type.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFInputStreamInfo.cbMaxLookahead
member.summary: Maximum amount of input data, in bytes, that the MFT holds to perform lookahead. Lookahead is the action of looking forward in the data before processing it. This value should be the worst-case value. If the MFT does not keep a lookahead buffer, the value is zero.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFInputStreamInfo.cbAlignment
member.summary: The memory alignment required for input buffers. If the MFT does not require a specific alignment, the value is zero.

member.name: T:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFOutputStreamInfo
member.summary: Contains information about an output stream on a Media Foundation transform (MFT). To get these values, call IMFTransform::GetOutputStreamInfo.
member.remarks: Before the media types are set, the only values that should be considered valid is the MFT_OUTPUT_STREAM_OPTIONAL flag in the dwFlags member. This flag indicates that the stream is optional and does not require a media type. After you set a media type on all of the input and output streams (not including optional streams), all of the values returned by the GetOutputStreamInfo method are valid. They might change if you set different media types.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFOutputStreamInfo.Flags
member.summary: Bitwise OR of zero or more flags from the _MFT_OUTPUT_STREAM_INFO_FLAGS enumeration.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFOutputStreamInfo.Size
member.summary: Minimum size of each output buffer, in bytes. If the MFT does not require a specific size, the value is zero. For uncompressed audio, the value should be the audio frame size, which you can get from the MF_MT_AUDIO_BLOCK_ALIGNMENT attribute in the media type. If the dwFlags member contains the MFT_OUTPUT_STREAM_PROVIDES_SAMPLES flag, the value is zero, because the MFT allocates the output buffers.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFOutputStreamInfo.cbAlignment
member.summary: The memory alignment required for output buffers. If the MFT does not require a specific alignment, the value is zero. If the dwFlags member contains the MFT_OUTPUT_STREAM_PROVIDES_SAMPLES flag, this value is the alignment that the MFT uses internally when it allocates samples. It is recommended, but not required, that MFTs allocate buffers with at least a 16-byte memory alignment.

member.name: M:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriter.GetServiceForStreamNative(System.Int32,System.Guid,System.Guid,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Queries the underlying media sink or encoder for an interface.
member.param: The zero-based index of a stream to query

A service identifier GUID, or GUID_NULL. If the value is GUID_NULL, the method calls QueryInterface to get the requested interface. Otherwise, the method calls IMFGetService::GetService. For a list of service identifiers, see Service Interfaces( http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms695350(v=vs.85).aspx ).
The interface identifier (IID) of the interface being requested.
Receives a pointer to the requested interface. The caller must release the interface.

member.summary: Queries the underlying media sink or encoder for an interface.
member.param: The zero-based index of a stream to query

A service identifier GUID, or GUID_NULL. If the value is GUID_NULL, the method calls QueryInterface to get the requested interface. Otherwise, the method calls IMFGetService::GetService. For a list of service identifiers, see Service Interfaces( http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms695350(v=vs.85).aspx ).
The interface identifier (IID) of the interface being requested.
member.returns: A pointer to the requested interface. The caller must release the interface.

member.summary: Phase differential between left and right LFOs. The default value is Phase90.

member.name: F:CSCore.AudioEncoding.MPEG_ADTS_AAC
member.summary: Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) audio in Audio Data Transport Stream (ADTS) format. The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_ADTS_AAC.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral band replication (SBR) or parametric stereo (PS) tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: F:CSCore.AudioEncoding.MPEG_RAW_AAC

member.name: F:CSCore.AudioEncoding.MPEG_LOAS
member.summary: MPEG-4 audio transport stream with a synchronization layer (LOAS) and a multiplex layer (LATM). The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_LOAS.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral SBR or PS tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: T:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX
member.summary: Values that are used in activation calls to indicate the execution contexts in which an object is to be run.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER
member.summary: The code that creates and manages objects of this class is a DLL that runs in the same process as the caller of the function specifying the class context.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_HANDLER
member.summary: Indicates a handler dll, which runs on the same process as the caller.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_LOCAL_SERVER
member.summary: Indicates a server executable, which runs on the same machine but on a different process than the caller.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER16
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_REMOTE_SERVER
member.summary: Indicates a server executable, which runs on a different machine than the caller.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_HANDLER16
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED1
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED2
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED3
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED4
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_NO_CODE_DOWNLOAD
member.summary: Indicates that code should not be allowed to be downloaded from the Directory Service (if any) or the Internet.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED5
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_NO_CUSTOM_MARSHAL
member.summary: Specify if you want the activation to fail if it uses custom marshalling.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ENABLE_CODE_DOWNLOAD
member.summary: Enables the downloading of code from the directory service or the Internet.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_NO_FAILURE_LOG
member.summary: Indicates that no log messages about activation failure should be written to the Event Log.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_DISABLE_AAA
member.summary: Indicates that activate-as-activator capability is disabled for this activation only.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ENABLE_AAA
member.summary: Indicates that activate-as-activator capability is enabled for this activation only.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_FROM_DEFAULT_CONTEXT
member.summary: Indicates that activation should begin from the default context of the current apartment.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_32_BIT_SERVER
member.summary: Activate or connect to a 32-bit version of the server; fail if one is not registered.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_64_BIT_SERVER
member.summary: Activate or connect to a 64 bit version of the server; fail if one is not registered.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ENABLE_CLOAKING
member.summary: When this flag is specified, COM uses the impersonation token of the thread, if one is present, for the activation request made by the thread. When this flag is not specified or if the thread does not have an impersonation token, COM uses the process token of the thread's process for the activation request made by the thread.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_APPCONTAINER
member.summary: Indicates activation is for an app container. Reserved for internal use.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_AAA_AS_IU
member.summary: Specify this flag for Interactive User activation behavior for As-Activator servers.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_PS_DLL
member.summary: Used for loading Proxy/Stub DLLs.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC
member.summary: Bitwise combination of the and the constants.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_SERVER
member.summary: Bitwise combination of the , the and the constants.

member.summary: Bitwise combination of the and the constants.

member.summary: Provides the managed definition of the IStream interface.

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.IStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Reads a specified number of bytes from the stream object into memory starting at the current seek pointer.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the data read from the stream. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
The number of bytes to read from the stream object.
A pointer to a ULONG variable that receives the actual number of bytes read from the stream object.

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.IStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Writes a specified number of bytes into the stream object starting at the current seek pointer.
member.param: The buffer to write this stream to.
he number of bytes to write to the stream.
On successful return, contains the actual number of bytes written to the stream object. If the caller sets this pointer to Zero, this method does not provide the actual number of bytes written.

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.IStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Changes the seek pointer to a new location relative to the beginning of the stream, to the end of the stream, or to the current seek pointer.
member.param: The displacement to add to dwOrigin.
The origin of the seek. The origin can be the beginning of the file, the current seek pointer, or the end of the file.
On successful return, contains the offset of the seek pointer from the beginning of the stream.

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.IStream.SetSize(System.Int64)
member.summary: Changes the size of the stream object.
member.param: The new size of the stream as a number of bytes.

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.IStream.CopyTo(CSCore.Win32.IStream,System.Int64,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Copies a specified number of bytes from the current seek pointer in the stream to the current seek pointer in another stream.
member.param: A reference to the destination stream.
The number of bytes to copy from the source stream.
On successful return, contains the actual number of bytes read from the source.
On successful return, contains the actual number of bytes written to the destination.

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.IStream.Commit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Ensures that any changes made to a stream object that is open in transacted mode are reflected in the parent storage.
member.param: A value that controls how the changes for the stream object are committed.

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.IStream.Revert
member.summary: Discards all changes that have been made to a transacted stream since the last Commit call.

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.IStream.UnlockRegion(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int32)

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.ComStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.summary: Sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.

member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream.

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.ComStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.summary: Defines filter parameters for a source voice.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterParameters.Type
member.summary: The .

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterParameters.Frequency
member.summary: Filter radian frequency calculated as (2 * sin(pi * (desired filter cutoff frequency) / sampleRate)). The frequency must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 1.0f. The maximum frequency allowable is equal to the source sound's sample rate divided by six which corresponds to the maximum filter radian frequency of 1. For example, if a sound's sample rate is 48000 and the desired cutoff frequency is the maximum allowable value for that sample rate, 8000, the value for Frequency will be 1.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterParameters.OneOverQ
member.summary: Reciprocal of Q factor. Controls how quickly frequencies beyond Frequency are dampened. Larger values result in quicker dampening while smaller values cause dampening to occur more gradually. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.5f.

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType
member.summary: Indicates the filter type.
member.remarks: Note Note that the DirectX SDK versions of XAUDIO2 do not support the LowPassOnePoleFilter or the HighPassOnePoleFilter.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.LowPassFilter
member.summary: Attenuates (reduces) frequencies above the cutoff frequency.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.BandPassFilter
member.summary: Attenuates frequencies outside a given range.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.HighPassFilter
member.summary: Attenuates frequencies below the cutoff frequency.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.NotchFilter
member.summary: Attenuates frequencies inside a given range.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.LowPassOnePoleFilter
member.summary: XAudio2.8 only: Attenuates frequencies above the cutoff frequency. This is a one-pole filter, and has no effect.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.HighPassOnePoleFilter
member.summary: XAudio2.8 only: Attenuates frequencies below the cutoff frequency. This is a one-pole filter, and has no effect.

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback
member.summary: The IXAudio2VoiceCallback interface contains methods that notify the client when certain events happen in a given .

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback.OnVoiceProcessingPassStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called during each processing pass for each voice, just before XAudio2 reads data from the voice's buffer queue.
member.param: The number of bytes that must be submitted immediately to avoid starvation. This allows the implementation of just-in-time streaming scenarios; the client can keep the absolute minimum data queued on the voice at all times, and pass it fresh data just before the data is required. This model provides the lowest possible latency attainable with XAudio2. For xWMA and XMA data BytesRequired will always be zero, since the concept of a frame of xWMA or XMA data is meaningless. Note: In a situation where there is always plenty of data available on the source voice, BytesRequired should always report zero, because it doesn't need any samples immediately to avoid glitching.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback.OnVoiceProcessingPassEnd
member.summary: Called just after the processing pass for the voice ends.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback.OnStreamEnd
member.summary: Called when the voice has just finished playing a contiguous audio stream.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback.OnBufferStart(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called when the voice is about to start processing a new audio buffer.
member.param: Context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.summary: Called when the voice finishes processing a buffer.
member.param: Context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.param: Context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2Voice.SetVolumeNative(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the overall volume level for the voice.
member.param: Overall volume level to use. See Remarks for more information on volume levels.
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. For more information see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ee415807(v=vs.85).aspx.
member.remarks: The master volume level is applied at different times depending on the type of voice. For submix and mastering voices the volume level is applied just before the voice's built in filter and effect chain is applied. For source voices the master volume level is applied after the voice's filter and effect chain is applied. Volume levels are expressed as floating-point amplitude multipliers between -2^24 and 2^24, with a maximum gain of 144.5 dB. A volume level of 1.0 means there is no attenuation or gain and 0 means silence. Negative levels can be used to invert the audio's phase.

Volume levels are expressed as floating-point amplitude multipliers between -2^24 and 2^24, with a maximum gain of 144.5 dB. A volume level of 1.0 means there is no attenuation or gain and 0 means silence. Negative levels can be used to invert the audio's phase.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2Voice.SetChannelVolumes(System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the volume levels for the voice, per channel. This method is valid only for source and submix voices, because mastering voices do not specify volume per channel.
member.param: Number of channels in the voice.
Array containing the new volumes of each channel in the voice. The array must have elements. See Remarks for more information on volume levels.
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. For more information see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ee415807(v=vs.85).aspx.
member.remarks: The master volume level is applied at different times depending on the type of voice. For submix and mastering voices the volume level is applied just before the voice's built in filter and effect chain is applied. For source voices the master volume level is applied after the voice's filter and effect chain is applied. Volume levels are expressed as floating-point amplitude multipliers between -2^24 and 2^24, with a maximum gain of 144.5 dB. A volume level of 1.0 means there is no attenuation or gain and 0 means silence. Negative levels can be used to invert the audio's phase.

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback
member.summary: Default implementation of the interface.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.ProcessingPassStart
member.summary: Called during each processing pass for each voice, just before XAudio2 reads data from the voice's buffer queue. The only argument passed to the eventhandler is the number of required bytes: The number of bytes that must be submitted immediately to avoid starvation. This allows the implementation of just-in-time streaming scenarios; the client can keep the absolute minimum data queued on the voice at all times, and pass it fresh data just before the data is required. This model provides the lowest possible latency attainable with XAudio2. For xWMA and XMA data BytesRequired will always be zero, since the concept of a frame of xWMA or XMA data is meaningless. Note: In a situation where there is always plenty of data available on the source voice, BytesRequired should always report zero, because it doesn't need any samples immediately to avoid glitching.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.ProcessingPassEnd
member.summary: Called just after the processing pass for the voice ends.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.StreamEnd
member.summary: Called when the voice has just finished playing a contiguous audio stream.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.BufferStart
member.summary: Called when the voice is about to start processing a new audio buffer. The only argument passed to the eventhandler is a context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.BufferEnd
member.summary: Called when the voice finishes processing a buffer. The only argument passed to the eventhandler is a context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.LoopEnd
member.summary: Called when the voice reaches the end position of a loop. The only argument passed to the eventhandler is a context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.VoiceError
member.summary: Called when a critical error occurs during voice processing. The first argument passed to the eventhandler is a context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted. The second argument passed to the eventhandler is the HRESULT error code of the critical error.

member.summary: Pointer to a buffer context provided in the that is processed currently, or, if the voice is stopped currently, to the next buffer due to be processed. is NULL if there are no buffers in the queue.

member.summary: Number of audio buffers currently queued on the voice, including the one that is processed currently.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceState.SamplesPlayed
member.summary: Total number of samples processed by this voice since it last started, or since the last audio stream ended (as marked with the flag). This total includes samples played multiple times due to looping. Theoretically, if all audio emitted by the voice up to this time is captured, this parameter would be the length of the audio stream in samples. If you specify when you call , this member won't be calculated, and its value is unspecified on return from . takes about one-third as much time to complete when you specify .

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.CalculateFlags
member.summary: Flags which define calculate flags for calculating the 3D audio parameters.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.CalculateFlags.Matrix
member.summary: Enables matrix coefficient table calculation.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.CalculateFlags.Delay
member.summary: Enables delay time array calculation (stereo only).

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.CalculateFlags.LpfDirect
member.summary: Enables low pass filter (LPF) direct-path coefficient calculation.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.CalculateFlags.LpfReverb
member.summary: Enables LPF reverb-path coefficient calculation.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.CalculateFlags.Reverb
member.summary: Enables reverb send level calculation.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.CalculateFlags.Doppler
member.summary: Enables Doppler shift factor calculation.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.CalculateFlags.EmitterAngle
member.summary: Enables emitter-to-listener interior angle calculation.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.CalculateFlags.ZeroCenter
member.summary: Fills the center channel with silence. This flag allows you to keep a 6-channel matrix so you do not have to remap the channels, but the center channel will be silent. This flag is only valid if you also set .

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.CalculateFlags.RedirectToLfe
member.summary: Applies an equal mix of all source channels to a low frequency effect (LFE) destination channel. It only applies to matrix calculations with a source that does not have an LFE channel and a destination that does have an LFE channel. This flag is only valid if you also set .

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Cone
member.summary: Specifies directionality for a single-channel non-Low-Frequency-Effect emitter by scaling DSP behavior with respect to the emitter's orientation.
member.remarks: For a detailed explanation of sound cones see .

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Cone.X3DAUDIO_2PI
member.summary: X3DAUDIO_2PI

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Cone.InnerAngle
member.summary: Inner cone angle in radians. This value must be within 0.0f to .

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Cone.OuterAngle
member.summary: Outer cone angle in radians. This value must be within InnerAngle to .

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Cone.InnerVolume
member.summary: Volume scaler on/within inner cone. This value must be within 0.0f to 2.0f.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Cone.OuterVolume
member.summary: Volume scaler on/beyond outer cone. This value must be within 0.0f to 2.0f.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Cone.InnerLPF
member.summary: LPF direct-path or reverb-path coefficient scaler on/within inner cone. This value is only used for LPF calculations and must be within 0.0f to 1.0f.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Cone.OuterLPF
member.summary: LPF direct-path or reverb-path coefficient scaler on or beyond outer cone. This value is only used for LPF calculations and must be within 0.0f to 1.0f.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Cone.InnerReverb
member.summary: Reverb send level scaler on or within inner cone. This must be within 0.0f to 2.0f.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Cone.OuterReverb
member.summary: Reverb send level scaler on/beyond outer cone. This must be within 0.0f to 2.0f.

member.summary: Defines a DSP setting at a given normalized distance.

member.summary: Normalized distance. This must be within 0.0f to 1.0f.

member.summary: DSP control setting.

member.summary: Receives the results from a call to . See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/microsoft.directx_sdk.x3daudio.x3daudio_dsp_settings%28v=vs.85%29.aspx for more details.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The number of source channels.
The number of destination channels.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.MatrixCoefficients
member.summary: Gets the caller provided array that will be initialized with the volume level of each source channel present in each destination channel. The array must have at least ( ) elements. The array is arranged with the source channels as the column index of the array and the destination channels as the row index of the array.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.DelayTimes
member.summary: Gets the caller provided delay time array, which receives delays for each destination channel in milliseconds. This array must have at least elements. X3DAudio doesn't actually perform the delay. It simply returns the coefficients that may be used to adjust a delay DSP effect placed in the effect chain. This won't be calculated if the flag is not specified when calling .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.SrcChannelCount
member.summary: Gets the number of source channels.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.DstChannelCount
member.summary: Gets the number of source channels.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.LPFDirectCoefficient
member.summary: Gets the LPF direct-path coefficient. Only calculated if the flag is specified when calling . When using X3DAudio with XAudio2 the value returned in the LPFDirectCoefficient member would be applied to a low pass filter on a source voice with .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.LPFReverbCoefficient
member.summary: Gets the LPF reverb-path coefficient. Only calculated if the flag is specified when calling .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.ReverbLevel
member.summary: Gets the reverb send level. Only calculated if the flag is specified when calling .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.DopplerFactor
member.summary: Gets the doppler shift factor. Scales the resampler ratio for Doppler shift effect, where: effective_frequency = DopplerFactor original_frequency. Only calculated if the flag is specified when calling . When using X3DAudio with XAudio2 the value returned in the DopplerFactor would be applied to a source voice with .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.EmitterToListenerAngle
member.summary: Gets the emitter-to-listener interior angle, expressed in radians with respect to the emitter's front orientation. Only calculated if the flag is specified when calling .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.EmitterToListenerDistance
member.summary: Gets the distance in user-defined world units from the listener to the emitter base position.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.EmitterVelocityComponent
member.summary: Gets the component of emitter velocity vector projected onto emitter-to-listener vector in user-defined world units per second. Only calculated if the flag is specified when calling .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.ListenerVelocityComponent
member.summary: Gets the component of listener velocity vector projected onto the emitter->listener vector in user-defined world units per second. Only calculated if the flag is specified when calling .

member.summary: Caller provided array that will be initialized with the volume level of each source channel present in each destination channel. The array must have at least ( ) elements. The array is arranged with the source channels as the column index of the array and the destination channels as the row index of the array.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.DspSettingsNative.DelayTimesPtr
member.summary: Caller provided delay time array, which receives delays for each destination channel in milliseconds. This array must have at least elements. X3DAudio doesn't actually perform the delay. It simply returns the coefficients that may be used to adjust a delay DSP effect placed in the effect chain. The member can be NULL if the flag is not specified when calling . Note This member is only returned when X3DAudio is initialized for stereo output. For typical Xbox 360 usage, it will not return any data at all.

Only calculated if the flag is specified when calling . When using X3DAudio with XAudio2 the value returned in the DopplerFactor would be applied to a source voice with .

member.summary: Emitter-to-listener interior angle, expressed in radians with respect to the emitter's front orientation. Only calculated if the flag is specified when calling .

member.summary: Distance in user-defined world units from the listener to the emitter base position.

member.summary: Component of emitter velocity vector projected onto emitter-to-listener vector in user-defined world units per second. Only calculated if the flag is specified when calling .

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter
member.summary: Defines a single-point or multiple-point 3D audio source that is used with an arbitrary number of sound channels.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.ReverbCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the reverb send level distance curve, or NULL to use default curve: [0.0f, 1.0f], [1.0f, 0.0f].

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.Cone
member.summary: Gets or sets the sound cone. Used only with single-channel emitters for matrix, LPF (both direct and reverb paths), and reverb calculations. NULL specifies the emitter is omnidirectional.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.OrientFront
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the front direction. This value must be orthonormal with . must be normalized when used. For single-channel emitters without cones is only used for emitter angle calculations. For multi channel emitters or single-channel with cones is used for matrix, LPF (both direct and reverb paths), and reverb calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.OrientTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the top direction. This value must be orthonormal with . is only used with multi-channel emitters for matrix calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in user-defined world units. This value does not affect .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.Velocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the velocity vector in user-defined world units/second. This value is used only for doppler calculations. It does not affect .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.InnerRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to be used for the inner radius calculations. If is 0, then no inner radius is used, but may still be used. This value must be between 0.0f and FLT_MAX.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.InnerRadiusAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to be used for the inner radius angle calculations. This value must be between 0.0f and /4.0 (which equals 45).

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.ChannelCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of emitters defined by the class. Must be greater than 0.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.ChannelRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance from that channels will be placed if is greater than 1. is only used with multi-channel emitters for matrix calculations. Must be greater than or equal to 0.0f.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.ChannelAzimuths
member.summary: Gets or sets the table of channel positions, expressed as an azimuth in radians along the channel radius with respect to the front orientation vector in the plane orthogonal to the top orientation vector. An azimuth of 2* specifies a channel is a low-frequency effects (LFE) channel. LFE channels are positioned at the emitter base and are calculated with respect to only, never . must have at least elements, but can be NULL if = 1. The table values must be within 0.0f to 2*. is used with multi-channel emitters for matrix calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.VolumeCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the volume-level distance curve, which is used only for matrix calculations. NULL specifies a specialized default curve that conforms to the inverse square law, such that when distance is between 0.0f and 1.0f, no attenuation is applied. When distance is greater than 1.0f, the amplification factor is ( 1.0f)/distance. At a distance of 2.0f, the sound will be at half volume or -6 dB, at a distance of 4.0f, the sound will be at one quarter volume or -12 dB, and so on. and are independent of each other. does not affect LFE channel volume.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.LowFrequencyEffectCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the LFE roll-off distance curve, or NULL to use default curve: [0.0f, 1.0f], [ 1.0f, 0.0f]. A NULL value for specifies a default curve that conforms to the inverse square law with distances <= clamped to no attenuation. and are independent of each other. does not affect non LFE channel volume.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.LowPassFilterDirectCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the low-pass filter (LPF) direct-path coefficient distance curve, or NULL to use the default curve: [0.0f, 1.0f], [1.0f, 0.75f]. is only used for LPF direct-path calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.LowPassFilterReverbCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the LPF reverb-path coefficient distance curve, or NULL to use default curve: [0.0f, 0.75f], [1.0f, 0.75f]. is only used for LPF reverb path calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.CurveDistanceScaler
member.summary: Gets or sets the curve distance scaler that is used to scale normalized distance curves to user-defined world units, and/or to exaggerate their effect. This does not affect any other calculations. The value must be within the range FLT_MIN to FLT_MAX. is only used for matrix, LPF (both direct and reverb paths), and reverb calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.DopplerScaler
member.summary: Doppler shift scaler that is used to exaggerate Doppler shift effect. is only used for Doppler calculations and does not affect any other calculations. The value must be within the range 0.0f to FLT_MAX.

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener
member.summary: Defines a point of 3D audio reception.
member.remarks: A listener's front and top vectors must be orthonormal. To be considered orthonormal, a pair of vectors must have a magnitude of 1 +- 1x10-5 and a dot product of 0 +- 1x10-5.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener.OrientFront
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of front direction. When is NULL OrientFront is used only for matrix and delay calculations. When is not NULL OrientFront is used for matrix, LPF (both direct and reverb paths), and reverb calculations. This value must be orthonormal with when used.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener.OrientTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of top direction, used only for matrix and delay calculations. This value must be orthonormal with when used.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in user-defined world units. This value does not affect .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener.Velocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the velocity vector in user-defined world units per second, used only for doppler calculations. This value does not affect .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener.Cone
member.summary: Gets or sets the to use. Providing a listener cone will specify that additional calculations are performed when determining the volume and filter DSP parameters for individual sound sources. A NULL value specifies an omnidirectional sound and no cone processing is applied. is only used for matrix, LPF (both direct and reverb paths), and reverb calculations.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2.CreateSubmixVoiceNative(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,System.Int32,CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceFlags,System.Int32,System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceSends},System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.EffectChain})
member.summary: Creates and configures a submix voice.
member.param: On success, returns a pointer to the new object.
Number of channels in the input audio data of the submix voice. The must be less than or equal to .
Sample rate of the input audio data of submix voice. This rate must be a multiple of . InputSampleRate must be between and .
Flags that specify the behavior of the submix voice. It can be or .

An arbitrary number that specifies when this voice is processed with respect to other submix voices, if the XAudio2 engine is running other submix voices. The voice is processed after all other voices that include a smaller value and before all other voices that include a larger value. Voices that include the same value are processed in any order. A submix voice cannot send to another submix voice with a lower or equal value. This prevents audio being lost due to a submix cycle.
List of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the submix voice. If is NULL, the send list will default to a single output to the first mastering voice created.
List of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the submix voice. This parameter is optional and can be null.

and . You can set InputSampleRate to , with the default being determined by the current platform.

member.summary: Creates and configures a source voice. For more information see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/microsoft.directx_sdk.ixaudio2.ixaudio2.createsourcevoice(v=vs.85).aspx.
member.param: If successful, returns a pointer to the new object.

Pointer to a . The following formats are supported:
8-bit (unsigned) integer PCM
16-bit integer PCM (optimal format for XAudio2)
20-bit integer PCM (either in 24 or 32 bit containers)
24-bit integer PCM (either in 24 or 32 bit containers)
32-bit integer PCM
32-bit float PCM (preferred format after 16-bit integer)
The number of channels in a source voice must be less than or equal to . The sample rate of a source voice must be between and .
that specify the behavior of the source voice. A flag can be or a combination of one or more of the following. Possible values are , and . is not supported on Windows.
Highest allowable frequency ratio that can be set on this voice. The value for this argument must be between and .
Client-provided callback interface, . This parameter is optional and can be null.
List of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the source voice. If is NULL, the send list defaults to a single output to the first mastering voice created.
List of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the source voice. This parameter is optional and can be null.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2_7.CreateSubmixVoiceNative(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,System.Int32,CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceFlags,System.Int32,System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceSends},System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.EffectChain})
member.summary: Creates and configures a submix voice.
member.param: On success, returns a pointer to the new object.
Number of channels in the input audio data of the submix voice. The must be less than or equal to .
Sample rate of the input audio data of submix voice. This rate must be a multiple of . InputSampleRate must be between and .
Flags that specify the behavior of the submix voice. It can be or .

An arbitrary number that specifies when this voice is processed with respect to other submix voices, if the XAudio2 engine is running other submix voices. The voice is processed after all other voices that include a smaller value and before all other voices that include a larger value. Voices that include the same value are processed in any order. A submix voice cannot send to another submix voice with a lower or equal value. This prevents audio being lost due to a submix cycle.
List of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the submix voice. If is NULL, the send list will default to a single output to the first mastering voice created.
List of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the submix voice. This parameter is optional and can be null.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2_7.CreateMasteringVoiceNative(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.EffectChain},CSCore.XAudio2.AudioStreamCategory)
member.summary: Creates and configures a mastering voice.
member.param: If successful, returns a pointer to the new object.

Number of channels the mastering voice expects in its input audio. must be less than or equal to . You can set InputChannels to , which causes XAudio2 to try to detect the system speaker configuration setup.

Sample rate of the input audio data of the mastering voice. This rate must be a multiple of . must be between and . You can set InputSampleRate to , with the default being determined by the current platform.
Flags that specify the behavior of the mastering voice. Must be 0.
Identifier of the device to receive the output audio. Specifying the default value of 0 (zero) causes XAudio2 to select the global default audio device.
structure that describes an effect chain to use in the mastering voice, or NULL to use no effects.

member.name: P:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioEndpointVolumeCallbackEventArgs.MasterVolume
member.summary: Specifies the current master volume level of the audio stream. The volume level is normalized to the range from 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 is the minimum volume level and 1.0 is the maximum level. Within this range, the relationship of the normalized volume level to the attenuation of signal amplitude is described by a nonlinear, audio-tapered curve.

member.name: P:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioEndpointVolumeCallbackEventArgs.ChannelVolumes
member.summary: The volume level for each channel is normalized to the range from 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 is the minimum volume level and 1.0 is the maximum level. Within this range, the relationship of the normalized volume level to the attenuation of signal amplitude is described by a nonlinear, audio-tapered curve.

member.name: M:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClient.GetBufferSize(System.UInt32@)
member.summary: The GetBufferSize method retrieves the size (maximum capacity) of the endpoint buffer.
member.remarks: The length is expressed as the number of audio frames the buffer can hold. The size in bytes of an audio frame is calculated as the number of channels in the stream multiplied by the sample size per channel. For example, the frame size is four bytes for a stereo (2-channel) stream with 16-bit samples.

member.name: M:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClient.GetStreamLatency(System.Int64@)
member.summary: The GetStreamLatency method retrieves the maximum latency for the current stream and can be called any time after the stream has been initialized.
member.remarks: Rendering clients can use this latency value to compute the minimum amount of data that they can write during any single processing pass. To write less than this minimum is to risk introducing glitches into the audio stream. For more information, see IAudioRenderClient::GetBuffer.

member.name: M:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClient.GetStreamLatency
member.summary: The GetStreamLatency method retrieves the maximum latency for the current stream and can be called any time after the stream has been initialized.
member.remarks: Rendering clients can use this latency value to compute the minimum amount of data that they can write during any single processing pass. To write less than this minimum is to risk introducing glitches into the audio stream. For more information, see IAudioRenderClient::GetBuffer.

member.name: M:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClient.IsFormatSupportedNative(CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientShareMode,CSCore.WaveFormat,CSCore.WaveFormat@)
member.summary: The IsFormatSupportedInternal method indicates whether the audio endpoint device supports a particular stream format.
member.returns: For exclusive mode, IsFormatSupportedInternal returns S_OK if the audio endpoint device supports the caller-specified format, or it returns AUDCLNT_E_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT if the device does not support the format. The ppClosestMatch parameter can be NULL. If it is not NULL, the method writes NULL to *ppClosestMatch. For shared mode, if the audio engine supports the caller-specified format, IsFormatSupportedInternal sets *ppClosestMatch to NULL and returns S_OK. If the audio engine does not support the caller-specified format but does support a similar format, the method retrieves the similar format through the ppClosestMatch parameter and returns S_FALSE. If the audio engine does not support the caller-specified format or any similar format, the method sets *ppClosestMatch to NULL and returns AUDCLNT_E_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT.

member.name: P:CSCore.WaveFormatExtensible.ValidBitsPerSample
member.summary: Gets the number of bits of precision in the signal. Usually equal to . However, is the container size and must be a multiple of 8, whereas can be any value not exceeding the container size. For example, if the format uses 20-bit samples, must be at least 24, but is 20.

member.name: P:CSCore.WaveFormatExtensible.SamplesPerBlock
member.summary: Gets the number of samples contained in one compressed block of audio data. This value is used in buffer estimation. This value is used with compressed formats that have a fixed number of samples within each block. This value can be set to 0 if a variable number of samples is contained in each block of compressed audio data. In this case, buffer estimation and position information needs to be obtained in other ways.

member.summary: Gets a bitmask specifying the assignment of channels in the stream to speaker positions.

member.name: T:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DataFlow
member.summary: Defines constants that indicate the direction in which audio data flows between an audio endpoint device and an application.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DataFlow.Render
member.summary: Audio rendering stream. Audio data flows from the application to the audio endpoint device, which renders the stream.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DataFlow.Capture
member.summary: Audio capture stream. Audio data flows from the audio endpoint device that captures the stream, to the application.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DataFlow.All
member.summary: Audio rendering or capture stream. Audio data can flow either from the application to the audio endpoint device, or from the audio endpoint device to the application.

member.name: T:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState
member.summary: Indicates the current state of an audio endpoint device.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState.Active
member.summary: The audio endpoint device is active. That is, the audio adapter that connects to the endpoint device is present and enabled. In addition, if the endpoint device plugs into a jack on the adapter, then the endpoint device is plugged in.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState.Disabled
member.summary: The audio endpoint device is disabled. The user has disabled the device in the Windows multimedia control panel, Mmsys.cpl. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState.NotPresent
member.summary: he audio endpoint device is not present because the audio adapter that connects to the endpoint device has been removed from the system, or the user has disabled the adapter device in Device Manager.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState.UnPlugged
member.summary: The audio endpoint device is unplugged. The audio adapter that contains the jack for the endpoint device is present and enabled, but the endpoint device is not plugged into the jack. Only a device with jack-presence detection can be in this state.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState.All
member.summary: Includes audio endpoint devices in all statesactive, disabled, not present, and unplugged.

member.name: M:CSCore.Win32.PropertyVariant.GetValue
member.summary: Warning: May return null if DataType is not supported.

member.name: T:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.Role

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.Role.Console
member.summary: Games, system notification sounds, and voice commands.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.Role.Multimedia
member.summary: Music, movies, narration, and live music recording.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.Role.Communications
member.summary: Voice communications (talking to another person).

member.name: T:CSCore.MediaFoundation.IMFAttributes
member.summary: Provides a generic way to store key/value pairs on an object. The keys are GUIDs, and the values can be any of the following data types: UINT32, UINT64, double, GUID, wide-character string, byte array, or IUnknown pointer. The standard implementation of this interface holds a thread lock while values are added, deleted, or retrieved. For a list of predefined attribute GUIDs, see Media Foundation Attributes. Each attribute GUID has an expected data type. The various "set" methods in IMFAttributes do not validate the type against the attribute GUID. It is the application's responsibility to set the correct type for the attribute. To create an empty attribute store, call MFCreateAttributes.

member.name: T:CSCore.Utils.CRC8
member.summary: http: //flac.sourceforge.net/format.html#frame_header CRC-8 (polynomial = x^8 + x^2 + x^1 + x^0, initialized with 0) of everything before the crc, including the sync code
